title: Compiled contract with size over 24kb leads to failed transactions with unclear error message

body: Can you provide more information about what test is failing specifically, any logs related to the failing test, and hopefully a stack trace?

[logs.txt](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/files/6414552/logs.txt)

yes, having this with main branch.

@kesar @snario I added the error logs to step 6 and corrected step 5.

The error is that the deploy file, `001_deploy_market_factory.ts`, cannot be processed.
The error code is:
`CALL_EXCEPTION`

commenting this  line that creates ERC20 ( https://github.com/PrediqtCom/prediqt-core/blob/main/src/ERC721/MarketERC721.sol#L49 ) 

without that line commented error goes to market factory
![unknown](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1288106/116895896-f04fc000-ac33-11eb-8486-487c8d016a1a.png)

with that line commented:
![unknown (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1288106/116895913-f3e34700-ac33-11eb-8f35-27de367e8b50.png)

so somehow, that line is breaking the deploy for step 1 (market factory)
errors on 002 and 003 are probably unrealted to 001 because those are from uniswap v3. if you notice in the beginning of 002 and 003_ there are some commented bytecodes / abis that are compiled with OVM for uniswap v3

@snario Thoughts on this issue?
I've spent quite some time trying to debug this with no luck
MIGHT be related to https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/736

> MIGHT be related to #736

Tried with this new version and get same error

> @platocrat - I have a strong feeling this is not related to our tooling, but rather trying to do an invalid call. I would check that

Same test suite works without OVM ( yarn test vs yarn test:ovm )

Bug seems to be in the line I commented above in ( https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/717#issuecomment-831330748 ) 

In this branch ( https://github.com/PrediqtCom/prediqt-core/tree/optimism ) if you comment the line where we create new tokens in the factory and run:

npx hardhat --network optimism compile
yarn test:ovm

market factory test works.

if you uncomment that line and run again the 2 commands, test fails with CALL_EXCEPTION

(all tests works if not using ovm)
@kesar can you try to isolate this down further as close to a single opcode as you can? That line you reference still make several more references to other contracts.

sure, I narrowed it down a bit more:

https://github.com/PrediqtCom/prediqt-core/commit/1330379729a8aaafb2805303a60c644e84f1dadf

I have the feeling its somehow related with gas.. removing the ERC20 specs and calling the code inside of method transferOwnership() seems to work, but if you actually call transferOwnership() it throws same error..

so I am wondering if it has to be related to the tx reaching a gas limit that its not handled by OVM somehow.
@kesar @snario  Another hacker just reported having this same issue when with their deployment script when testing against Kovan as well
Looking into this now

> @kesar @snario Another hacker just reported having this same issue when with their deployment script when testing against Kovan as well

Can you please provide reproduction steps, logs, details about this etc

I went ahead and reproduced the error. Definitely confirmed. My 95% confidence interval guess here is that the contract is just too big and the safety check runs out of gas. I think [this line that was linked earlier in the thread](https://github.com/PrediqtCom/prediqt-core/blob/main/src/ERC721/MarketERC721.sol#L49) is a red herring since it's inside the `create` function and not inside the constructor. I think commenting out that line causes the deployment to work because it means the Solidity compiler won't include that whole ERC20 file in the source for the MarketFactory.
If that is indeed the issue, how could we have surfaced this sooner?

We should really be surfacing this as a special error type that gets propagated to the user. "Tx failed because safety check failed (ran out of gas, was your contract too big?)." Too confusing for people otherwise

> If that is indeed the issue, how could we have surfaced this sooner?

One way would be to use `eth_call` and look at the returndata, the first 4 bytes should be `keccack('Error(string))[0:4]'`. Newer versions of `geth` decode those 4 bytes automatically and return a nice message

This has been a common user error, since deployments will silently revert and they will attempt to call non-existent contracts. Opened an issue to create a test for this here https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/761

> We should really be surfacing this as a special error type that gets propagated to the user. "Tx failed because safety check failed (ran out of gas, was your contract too big?)." Too confusing for people otherwise

100% - https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/648

thanks for helping with the debug! indeed it was related with contract size. I extracted the erc20 creation into a separate contract to avoid adding erc20 dependencies into the erc721, and its working fine! 👍🏻 

Perhaps its worth documenting that contract size might be slightly different between EVM and OVM ( https://community.optimism.io/docs/protocol/evm-comparison.html#behavioral-differences ) I guess related to optimizer? because those contracts were fine on EVM
Was there not a compiler warning about your artifacts being larger than 24kb?

> Was there not a compiler warning about your artifacts being larger than 24kb?

When I compiled his contracts, there was no OVM compiler warning about the size of artifacts.
https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/779
